intro: Peucedanum depauperatum, commonly known as the slender cowparsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in dry, rocky habitats across Europe. The plant has slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and often covered in a fine layer of hairs. It is noted for its low-growing habit and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
